description:
Mrs. Mitzi Phillips Welcome to your first year of English at Cypress Woods High School! I hope you are as excited as I am for the 2013 - 2014 school year! 

 For information most vital to this class, please access the following link:
 
 http://phillipsenglishi.weebly.com/
 
 I am using Reminder 101 as a tool for both parents and students to receive frequent reminders of upcoming assessments, major tests and major projects for my class this year. Students will receive this information on the first day of class, so these instructions are primarily for parents who are interested in being informed of important upcoming assignments.
 
For students enrolled in Mrs. Phillips's K level English class:
 
1. Add the following number to your contacts -- 469-208-3595
2. Send the following text to this number -- @englishik
3. You will receive a text to send me your name so that I know who is enrolled.
4. At this point, you are enrolled and will receive any text that is sent to the class :)
 
For students enrolled in Mrs. Phillips's H level English Class:
 
1. Add the following number to your contacts -- 469-208-3595
2. Send the following text to this number -- @phillipseh
3. You will receive a text to send me your name so that I know who is enrolled.
4. At this point, you are enrolled and will receive any text that is sent to the class :)
 
 
I am looking forward to getting to know each one of you, and in order for you to know a little about me, I am including a little bit of background information on me. 
 

 Mitzi Phillips
 Mitzi.Phillips@cfisd.net
 
 Grade: 9

 Subject(s): English I - K, and English I - H
 Conference time: 8:25 - 9:10
 Other:Tutorials -- Daily Morning 6:45 - 7:15 or Afternoons Tuesday and Wednesday 2:45 - 3:10
 
 
 Graduated Magna Cum Laud from Sam Houston State University Major: English Minor: DanceTaught English and the dance team at Willis High School from 1986 - 1993Taught the nationally acclaimed dance team at LanghamCreek High School -- 1993 - 2007This is my eighth year to teach English at Cypress Woods High School -- 2007 - presentGT Certified
 Awards and Honors: Tyler Junior College Apache Belle -- 1981 - 1983 Recognized by SHSU English faculty for Outstanding Academic Achievement -- 1986 Director of the Year for the state of Texas -- 2004 Wall of Fame for Cypress Fairbanks I. S. D. -- 2004 Who's Who Among American High School Teachers -- 1999 - 2013
 
 Philosophy of Education
 I knew from the time I was in high school that I wanted to teach. Throughout my life, I have enjoyed school and learning, and I knew that I could make other people enjoy education as much as I did. I try to give my students the skills that will enable them to do what they really want to do in life, and not settle for what will simply get them through life. So much of our lifetime is spent "on the job" that if we are not happy in our work, our quality of life suffers. I try to teach my students that the more educated they are, the more choices they have, and the more choices they have, the greater the opportunity for happiness and a fulfilling life.
subject: English I
name: Phillips, Mitzi

description:
Welcome Note Welcome to the 2012-2013 school year at Cypress Woods High School! I am Doug Chumley, and I am teaching your child's English I class this year. 
 
Reading and writing are some of the most important skills that a student can master. Effective reading enables us to learn absolutely anything. A mastery of writing allows us to say exactly what we mean to say the way that it needs to be said. My class is about teaching and sharpening these skills in my students.
 
Feel free to contact me a douglas.chumley@cfisd.net if you have any questions or concerns. Have a great year.
 
 Doug Chumley
 English I
 Cypress Woods High School
subject: English I

description:
Welcome to my portfolio page! I'm beginning my 24th year in education and my second full time year at Cy Woods. I'm excited to be teaching 10th grade English at Cypress Woods High School! The staff is fabulous, the curriculum rich and the pride strong. This year is going to be exciting and I can't wait to get started! 
 Originally from Pittsburgh, PA (yes, die-hard Steeler fan), I attended college at Bowling Green State University where I received my Bachelor of Science in Education. While teaching in Cincinnati, OH, I earned my Master of Education from Xavier University. One of my most meaningful professional experiences while in Ohio was attending the Ohio Writing Project. From this six hour graduate course, I learned about the writing process and how to help students become stronger writers. I am hoping to share those techniques with students this year.
 
 On a more personal level, I am heading into my 23rd year of marriage and have two daughters, Maddy a freshman Longhorn and Cameron a sophomore at Woods. I also have two dogs, Grace and Willy.
 
 I am so excited to get the year started! Feel free to email me when you have questions or concerns throughout the year.

My education and degrees include a recently completed Masters in Library Science and Information Studies, coursework that earned me the equivalent of a bachelors in Education, and a BBA in Accounting.

description:
Sophomore English Welcome to 10th grade English! It's the best - - really, I promise! This year we will explore compelling, thought-provoking literature as we push (and pull) our writing skills to new heights! It's going to be a great ride and I'm glad you're coming along!
 
On a personal note, this will be my fourth year at Cy-Woods. Before joining the Woods team, I was a grant writer for Harris County MHMR and a teacher with the Harris County Department of Education. I have been married for twenty years and am the mother of two teenage boys who both inspire and challenge me each and every day! My oldest is a senior at Ranch and my youngest, a freshman at Woods; As you can see, parents, I'm right there in the trenches with you!
 
As both an educator and a parent I am deeply invested in and committed to the education, success, and well-being of our Cy-Fair students. Thus, I strive to be the teacher to my students that I would want for my own children!

Welcome to World History! Welcome to World History at Cypress Woods High School! I am so excited to have you in my class this year. Throughout this course, I hope to help you develop good studying and notetaking skills as well as increase your awareness of current events in our world today. Our class will involve lots of discussion and debate, so don't be shy about sharing your opinion. My final goal is for each of my students to feel as though I did my absolute best for them, so please know that I am here for YOU, and I am willing to help you in any way I can. Please visit our World History wikispace at cwwh.wikispaces.com for more information, or follow me on Twitter (@GillihanHistory). 
 
A little bit about me...I graduated from Cy Creek High School before attending Texas A M! I am a loud and proud Aggie! I love to run, cook, read, and travel. I am also the Varsity cheer coach at Woods. I can't wait to learn more about each of you as we go through this year together!

description:
Math Teacher 
Hello Wildcats! My name is Ann Marie Gorman and I teach Algebra 2 here at the Woods. I received my BA from the University of St. Thomas in Houston, where I majored in both Math and French. My husband and I have four children - twin boys (grade 10) and two girls (grades 6 and 8). Our family keeps busy with soccer, swim team, football and band throughout the year. I welcome you to a challenging, yet rewarding, year in Algebra 2. For assistance in your studies, please visit both our Algebra 2 website (which includes our testing/homework calendar for each six weeks and our tutoring schedule) and our Algebra 2 online textbook (which includes access to an online graphing calculator and a video tutor for each lesson). Please contact me for the password to the textbook (it will be provided in class as well).
 
Tutoring is provided for all Algebra 2 students by one of our Algebra 2 teachers every Monday through Thursday from 2:40-3:10. A video tutor is also available through the Algebra 2 online textbook.
 
 Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns: annmarie.gorman@cfisd.net. 
I look forward to meeting you and to a great year!

description:
Welcome! I am happy to say this is my 14th year teaching, all of them in CFISD. Before coming to help open CyWoods as a charter member, I was an 8th grade math/ Algebra 1 teacher at Hamilton Middle School. Upon arrival here, I began teaching Geometry K/H, and then about five years ago, I added on AP Statistics. The program has steadily grown, and I thrilled about it! This year I decided to also teach another course, AQR, and I think we are really going to enjoy it. I am truly blessed to say that I love what I do!
 
 In the little bit of free time that I have, I enjoy spending time with my husband and our two kids. Our favorite vacation spot is DisneyWorld, and we go as often as we can. It truly is a magical place! 
 
 Before becoming a teacher, I worked in the corporate world for a couple of years as an oil and gas accountant, having earned a BBA in Accounting from Texas A M University. WHOOP! I quickly realized that career was not for me, and I have never looked back! It is a privilege to be able to work with these AMAZING students each day. I can honestly say I have the best job! 
 
My tutoring days are Tuesday and Wednesday afternoons, and if you need more help or clarification, please just ask! I am here for you, and happy to help! 
We are going to have a FANTASTIC YEAR!

description:
Welcome Course Description - Anatomy and Physiology
 Anatomy and Physiology is a college preparatory course designed to extend the student's knowledge and understanding of the human body in respect to its structure and function. A survey of each organ system is presented with intitial emphasis upon its anatomy, followed by an in-depth study of its physiology. This course is lab-oriented and teaches proper dissection techniques as well as various physiology phenomena. This course is for student pursuing an education in the medical sciences
About Me:
 After graduating from Cypress Creek High School, I attended Texas A M University and received a B.S. in Biomedical Science. I worked as an EMT and CPR instructor for Cypress Creek EMS and volunteered on the ambulance for 3 years before I started working at Westfield High School as a Biology teacher. In 2007, I joined the Wildcat family at Cypress Woods High School as a Biology teacher. In 2008, I became the Anatomy and Physiology teacher, and have been teaching it ever since. My goal is to prepare your child's young, eager mind for the challenges that await them in college and their career.

RETEACH/RETEST
At Cypress Woods High School, it is our focus to work side-by-side with all students in order to reach the highest levels of mastery possible. A student's grade should be reflective of his/her level of mastery. Students at Cypress Woods High School shall be afforded the following opportunity each grading period in each course:
 
Replace one major or assessment grade
The replacement grade may be earned from the score of a re-test of a previously attempted test or from the score of a cumulative test given at the end of the grading period. (Discretion of each academic team)
Attendance to at lease one re-teach session is mandated prior to retesting.
Re-test date will be determined by each academic team and communicated to students.
The higher grade will be awarded.

description:
Welcome to Mrs. Hughes' Page I cannot believe this is my seventh year teaching at Cypress Woods High School! Time really does fly when you are having fun. I believe I really do have the BEST job ever! I am a product of Cypress Fairbanks ISD. I attended Bang, Campbell (for one year), Cook and graduated from Jersey Village High School in 2003. I am also a proud member of the Fightin' Texas Aggie class of 2007, graduating Summa Cum Laude with a degree in Mathematics. I love teaching because I enjoy being able to develop relationships with my students and hopefully be a positive person of influence in their lives, as they are at a pivotal time. I have taught Geometry K and L, Precalculus K and AP Calculus AB and BC. I absolutely love teaching Calculus, and take such joy in seeing my students be successful in mathematics and continuing relationships with them after they gradate. In my spare time I enjoy spending time with my husband (we got married this summer!) and reading, training for half marathons, crafting, volleyball, traveling, baking and reading. The three most important things in my life are my faith, family and friends.

description:
Writing Wildcats Rock! "The difference between the almost right word and the right word is really a large matter--'tis the difference between the lightning bug and the lightning."--Mark Twain
 
 Writing is our English Department focus at Cypress Woods High School. Our goal is to help students convey their ideas in the clearest, most effective way possible. Whether it is a personal narrative, a rhetorical analysis essay, a research paper, a business letter, or a college application essay--all good writing must have intensity, insight and precision. Many times in writing, it is not a question of right or wrong--but rather weak or strong. Good writing requires trenchant thinking! Rethinking and rewriting are the workhorses of great writing. Fine writing skills will never go out of style and are valuable in all fields. I count it a great honor to help students become stronger writers. 
 Before teaching, I worked as a writer for newspapers, magazines, and a publishing company. My first job after graduating from the University of Missouri School of Journalism was with Bon App tit magazine. One of my most exciting jobs was working with the Kansas City-based publisher Andrews and McMeel, Inc., where I wrote jacket blurbs for books and press releases and organized author book tours. After moving to Houston, I worked as a technical editor at Brown and Root, Inc. and a technical writer at Gray Tool Company. Then I stayed home to raise children until my youngest entered third grade. I have a civil engineer husband who grows weary of all my "papers to grade," and three grown children who phone or skype from faraway places such as Istanbul...Princeton...Oxford...Santa Barbara! I love to read with my little dog Blakie (named after William Blake, the poet) scrunched up beside me. Some of the best work I read is not by famous writers, but by my students.
